page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: CANALS The Stratford-upon-Avon Canal crosses the block from N.W.to S.E. Today it is used mainly for pleasure & recreation.Most of the boats are converted narrow-boats or cabin cruisers.In places the tow-path is in very poor condition due to erosion caused by,the wash of boats, pedestrians & lack of maintenance.A striking feature in this area is a lifting bridge known locally as the "Draw-bridge".The bridge is operated with a special key carried by the boat passengers.Approximately 400m from the Draw-bridge the canal crosses a road via an Aqueduct.This feature gives its name to the road passing beneath. Fishing is a popular recreation carried on along the tow-path.
